home.alcomDescription: A fast and open-source VRChat Creator Companion alternative
home.cliDescription: A fast and open-source VRChat Package Manager alternative

alcom.hero: A fast open-source alternative of VRChat Creator Companion

fullName.question: What does ALCOM stand for?
fullName.answer: ALCOM is the complete name of the application, not an acronym.

nameOrigin.question: Where did the word ALCOM come from?
nameOrigin.answer:
ALCOM was originally derived from the term ALternative (VRChat Creator) COMpanion.
However, alternative companion isn't the name of this tool; it's a description of its purpose.

vrcGetRelationship.question: What's the relationship with vrc-get-gui and vrc-get?
vrcGetRelationship.answer: ALCOM is a graphical user interface designed for managing VRChat packages. It's built on top of the open-source command-line tool vrc-get. Previously known as vrc-get-gui, ALCOM offers a more user-friendly way to install, update, and manage VRChat assets.

cli.hero: A fast and open-source VRChat Package Manager alternative

homebrew.title: Using homebrew
homebrew.content: If you're using Homebrew, you can easily install vrc-get.

macPorts.title: Using MacPorts
macPorts.content: If you're using MacPorts, you can easily install vrc-get with MacPorts.

winget.title: Using winget
winget.content: If you're using modern versions of Windows 10 or 11, you can install vrc-get with winget.

scoop.title: Using scoop
scoop.content: If you're using scoop, you can install vrc-get from a scoop bucket.

aur.title: Using PKGBUILD from AUR
aur.content: If you're using Arch Linux, you can install vrc-get from Arch User Repository. Please use your favorite AUR helpers.

cargoBinstall.title: Using cargo binstall
cargoBinstall.content: If you have cargo binstall, installing with cargo binstall is an easy & fast way to install vrc-get. Cargo binstall will download & install prebuilt vrc-get from GitHub.

cargo.title: Using cargo
cargo.content: If you have cargo, installing with cargo is an easy way to install vrc-get.
